text.text: Very nice experience staying in Sterling Fern hill Ooty. Room was neat and clean. The staff is excellent and take care of your needs and requests. Breakfast buffet spread is more than sufficient. Mattress could be harder, but that could be personal preference for me. Location is 15min from Ooty central area.. no problem if you have your own vehicle, road is good. Location is good in a way that there is no city noise, and being higher up.. the weather is better than city and air is fresh. Would come back again, no hesitation in recommending.

editorialSummary.text: Casual rooms, suites & villas with lake views in a low-key resort featuring a restaurant.

text.text:
It was a nice stay at hotel lake view.
Few are the good and bad things about hotel.

Good:
1.Dual room facility is really Good.
2.Dinning and bed room area is separate.
3.Hotel is very well maintained.
4.Staff is really good.
5.Food is good in hotel.

Bad:
1.We requested to boil a food (for approx 5 min) for 2 years kid by adding half glass of milk (all other stuff we provided), they applied charges.
2.Usable water at lake view is the worst i found. ( full yellow water )
3.Hotel is not in much approachable area from city bus stand/auto stand, so you may have to spend more if u do not have own vehicle.

text.text:
Highly Highly Recommended.!
It's a perfect place to stay in Ooty without any doubt on safety.
Rooms are well maintained. Top class neat and clean.
Executive Suite rooms are equipped with Camp Fire setup and it's based on our ask at a small additional cost.
The food is good at their restaurant, which is located inside. Quality, Taste and Service - Nothing concerns this. Only concern is additional cost on delivering to room.

The hotel is highly attractive in its presence.
Parking space is available just in front of our rooms and it's constructed in a spacious manner.

You can't roam outside after 19:00 and should opt for a cab or auto for transportation. The Transport Helpdesk team would help on the request basis.

editorialSummary.text: Cosy rooms in a polished lodging with tranquil gardens, an international restaurant & a spa.

text.text:
Clean rooms, good room service. Very polite staffs.

Has amazing views from the lawn. There are adventure games and other activities at the holiday centre to keep us entertained.

There’s also bonfire in the evening with live music, games, dance and fun.

Buffet could be better. Not great taste wise nor many food options. Opt for outside restaurants since there are plenty of good places with different cuisines.

text.text:
Afternoon check-in at 2 p.m. for our hotel room type (H). We arrived at the club at 3.20 pm and had our room by 4.45 pm, which is a pretty long wait.
After that, the room arrangement was not done properly, so we called them over the intercom two or three times finally we received our bathroom kit and towels the next morning.
Regarding food, we received a three-meal package, the dinner which we got few items and medium-level tasty food but breakfast is not bad food and next day we got a junior suite room that was very nice But as usual, they didn't keep a bathroom kit and towel in the room.

text.text: We visited this resort in first weekend of August 2023 and must say the location is awesome. The rooms and not luxurious,  but was cleaned and had everything that was required with a nice view of hills. Buffet spread was nice and you could negotiate with the staff if opting for a package. Play area for kids, activity area, Shri Krishna temple and evening campfire with DJ and fun activities were so engaging that we didn't feel the need to go out of resort. Worth visiting this place.

text.text: We had an amazing experience by staying this hotel and walked around the places. The Staffs are awesome, they are very helpful and make us to feel like home. The food was variety and tasty, they served on time. Nice place with beautiful views and good ambience and amazing beautiful garden. Room was very spacious and clean. Breakfast spread good, though limited non-veg option. Overall the room, staff, environment and food quality  was best and good. I would like to give 5 star.

text.text:
Actually we have been to Gem park couple of times previously, but this time everything has changed drastically from the staff attitude, to their service , food, charges everything has changed!!
For everything, they have money in mind. Before booking I personally called and asked about 31st New year they said for in house guest-  party is free. After reaching their they told chargeable 9000/- couple. Secondly we just wanted a small photo session in garden for that they asked 3000/- (later on request they waived) , then dinner was included in our package but they created a lot and lot of confusion and extremely unprofessional and again charged us 900/- for it!
And just because we did not opt for the party (as their was alcohol also, so we were forced to sit in room and order dinner. On 31st night we came out to resort to enjoy and on contrary we are forced to sit inside room, so pathetic!!)
We regret that we cancelled our 31st night from Sterling to here. But was left with a complete disappointment.
It's not at all the same hotel which was very good at once.
Will think if has to visit next time. Instead Club Mahindra is very nice in all aspect as compared to Gem park.

text.text: I had a delightful two-night stay at Gem Park Ooty. Perched on a hilltop, the panoramic views were breathtaking. The staff was incredibly supportive, and the rooms were spacious. The breakfast variety was impressive, matching the standards of top-notch hotels. Highly recommended for a memorable Ooty experience.

text.text:
Great location and property, but avoid for next 1 year or so.

Pros -
Location is amazing with scenic views.
Greenery is well maintained.
Food - Good spread for breakfast. Dinner- ok spread. Deserts menu is not up to the mark.

Cons -
Room service is bit slow. Sometimes you have to call twice for the same thing.

Rooms are up for renovation. Broken locks, broken windows, broken furniture in some cases. I got to know they have started the renovation from the top floor though.

Recreation area is not maintained. Poor quality carrom boards. Kids play area has rusty slides and swings.

Swimming pool is under renovation.

Considering all these things and the price they charge, the premium is not worth. Maybe when they are done with renovation, the prices may get justified.

P.S. - Gym opens at 7.30 am in the morning. This itself is too late. On top of that their staff takes the keys at home, so they can’t open unless the person is back. I was told the person is running late by half an hour so the gym will open when he is here. I mean why someone carries such things at home and leaves guests waiting.😶

text.text: A very memorable experience at Zostel Ooty.A very helpful staff + a friendly manager made the stay comfortable. The perfect destination for solo travelers. The location is hilltop with a beautiful view of the city.The temperature is very chilly at night but the bonfire makes up for it! Value for money in terms of food is spot on. I'll recommend this place to everyone who is travelling solo. You'll definitely make some friends here.

text.text: Accord Highland, located in Ooty, is a stunning accommodation. I really enjoyed my experience there. This hotel is located in the middle of beautiful nature with stunning mountain views. text.text:
I would want to break this review down for the 3 star rating which i consider is Good.

1. First star goes for there service , staff was really amazing and very helpful, receptionist suresh was very kind. May it is room service or service in the restaurant, they have excellent staff who are very nice people.

2.second star goes for there rooms , very well designed cottages. Very clean , they have a smart TV which is a plus . The view was also really good.

3. Third star goes to the taste of food which I really liked , although they can definitely improve on the menu. Taste wise they have done a good job.

Now the reason for cutting down the two stars…(please note before you book)

1. Do not book this location if you want to use the SPA and want to have a staycation setup , although there website says Ayatana resort & Spa , this place does not have a spa and you will be disappointed if you are planning a staycation
2. Yes they have a fireplace inside your room or they do arrange private bon fire behind your room(balcony) , but they charge a whooping 1500/-rs plus tax for it and the wood logs they get doesn’t last for more than 20 mins , this has to change. The room charges are expensive and this extra charge for a bon fire of 30 mins is a disappointment again.
3. If you have bought dinner buffet , please note that you will not be allowed to carry your food to your room. Let’s say you have a group of friends who plan to party late and eat late after a drink , well there restaurant closes at 10:30pm , dinner won’t be served after that and yes if you plan to serve your food to a plate and take it to your room and have it later , well it’s not allowed (not sure why they have this , while the big guns like taj or hyatt allow this )
4. Yes, this place has a very serene vibe however this place is bit far from Ooty. And DO NOT , DO NOT step out during the night trusting google maps because the map does not recognise the right route and you will be lost. The place is very remote and you will be lost in a remote area. Absolutely doesn’t feel safe. The resort does not have any signboards to guide you , not sure why a resort of a such big chain does not have sign boards or advertisement boards to guide and show the remaining distance.
5. No much activities if you are planning a staycation, resorts or home stays around the same area are offering a lot of activities. This resort only has archery and a rope activity for kids nothing else to do
6. Taking of one star for the room as a heater is definitely recommended, the rooms get freezing cold because of the granite and the sheet roofing. So a heater is needed

text.text:
It was a fabulous holiday in Ooty,  especially  our  stay at the Savoy. A lovely quintessential  English Raj style hotel.  Such hotels  are hard to come by. Every  detail was minutely looked into. The decor was exquisitely tuned to the era which the hotel chose to represent.
The service  was par excellence. Personalized, warm and and thoroughly  professional.
The food was personalized  whenever required.
Most importantly the music which played  in the background,  even as we relaxed on the lawns with a bonfire crackling away was subdued at just the right volume...not the loud, wild music one is usually forced to bear up with.
A hotel I would  visit again, and I strongly  recommend it to those who appreciate the softness and the class of an era which is slowly fading into history.

text.text:
Stayed Feb 2024

This hostel (chain?) requires guests to install an app on their phones in order to 1 - check in, 2 - unlock room door, 3 - order from the cafe menu.

I am 100% against being coerced into installing unwanted software to my personal devices, especially when it's solely for the convenience of an entity whom I am paying for the services of.

That aside, the process broke down into a convoluted mess right off the bat by being far less streamlined than jotting down a few details into a visitor book with a biro, or Heaven forbid, the receptionist typing it into their system.

After installing the GoStops app to my phone and going through the OTP and booking retrieval there was some issue where the room door unlock feature would not initialise. Meaning I was left with no way to access my own room for the course of my 2 day stay.
I had to go to reception and request someone to come and open my room door with a good old fashioned key (the irony), each time I wanted to access my room.

I stayed in Ooty for 1 more night after those 2 days, and quite happily went to the trouble of moving to another accommodation rather than extending with this shower.

Oh, and the price of the bed per night was extortion. 50% higher than the next most expensive dorm I've stayed in India,  which was in Bhandra, Mumbai at peak season after Christmas and into the New Year. There's absolutely no comparison between the locations and the season in these 2 instances.

A big round of applause to GoStops. 0 steps forward, and 2 back.
I'll be sure never to consider booking with them again.
GoStops? StopGoing!

I am 100% against being coerced into installing unwanted software to my personal devices, especially when it's solely for the convenience of an entity whom I am paying for the services of.

That aside, the process broke down into a convoluted mess right off the bat by being far less streamlined than jotting down a few details into a visitor book with a biro, or Heaven forbid, the receptionist typing it into their system.

After installing the GoStops app to my phone and going through the OTP and booking retrieval there was some issue where the room door unlock feature would not initialise. Meaning I was left with no way to access my own room for the course of my 2 day stay.
I had to go to reception and request someone to come and open my room door with a good old fashioned key (the irony), each time I wanted to access my room.

I stayed in Ooty for 1 more night after those 2 days, and quite happily went to the trouble of moving to another accommodation rather than extending with this shower.

Oh, and the price of the bed per night was extortion. 50% higher than the next most expensive dorm I've stayed in India,  which was in Bhandra, Mumbai at peak season after Christmas and into the New Year. There's absolutely no comparison between the locations and the season in these 2 instances.

A big round of applause to GoStops. 0 steps forward, and 2 back.
I'll be sure never to consider booking with them again.
GoStops? StopGoing!

text.text:
First of all this is not a hotel or resort, this is a hostel for bagpackers. I booked refering reviews but it seems all other reviews are paid reviews. You shouldn't consider this for family purpose due to following reasons:
1. Location: Very remote place not much scenic as other properties. You will find nothing nearby. This place is not safe fof family.
2. Rooms: As this is a hostel there is no privacy. All rooms are at ground floor hence you can not open curtains. I booked most expensive heritage room but all money wasted. Reception counter is placed at room entry door. You can listen what going on outside and  others can listen whats going on inside.
3.Amenities: You will get nothing. Even they wont provide toiletries. There is no AC /heater and basic amenities like water jar/kettle in the room.
4.  Food : Very poor quality food. There is no restaurant/ seating place to eat food. We ordered chicken but we took only one bite. O think it was not chiken, it was something else. They will not provide water even if you ready to pay.
5. Service : Pathetic service. Whatever you ask staff will say no. We requested room heater or bonfire due to very low temperature. But they didn't provide. There is nothing they can service. Management is arrogant and money minded.

If you are family this is not a right place for you. You will get better and cheaper options in Ooty.

text.text:
Visited this place during republic day long weekend. Rooms and location are great and a big plus for this hotel. Service is really pathetic. No hot water throughout the day. Suddenly water stops coming and spoil your entire travel plan. Coming to food, they have inhouse restaurant, but you need to wait half an hour for every order. Surprisingly, for curd rice too. Buffet breakfast is included for few, but the same menu everyday, you need to wait again 30 mins if the item is completed, for them to refill it. Someone scratched my car when it was parked, but the security person doesn't even know how it happened.

It's of worth only if you get some deal around 3k to 3.5k for a premium Lake view room. Else it's totally waste. Better to go for some premium resorts or hotels , atleast to get some professional service.

Totally, average stay experience here

text.text:
I recently stayed here for 3 days and was pleasantly surprised by the value for the money. Despite being more affordable compared to similar properties in the area, one of the highlights was the ample parking space available, which is a big plus for travelers like me who prefer driving. The rooms were pretty spacious and also has separate water heaters which many of the properties in Ooty don't have.

The property itself is on the older side and shows some signs of wear and tear and it lacks in modernity. The entire hotel, including the rooms, are maintained with great care and tidiness.

The breakfast experience was good, though that not all menu items were available. The team was friendly, and always willing to help, which added to the overall positive experience.

text.text:
One of my worst stays ever.
1. Building was old and rooms were small. There were little to no amenities in the enitre hotel. The double bed in the room took up almost the entirety of the room and the bathroom felt small and cluttered. In the room, there were two glasses, one water jug, no towels as well and the bathroom contained only soap, nothing else. One counter in the room was broken and would have completely flipped if I had put pressure. Geyser was not working. The entire hotel felt unhygienic and unclean.
2. Service was lackluster. There were few staff and during breakfast I felt nobody was paying attention.
3. Food was absolutely bland. Sambhar had no Salt, they forgot sugar in tea and there were not many items in the breakfast buffet. The tea felt like hot water but the only reason I drank it because the table I sat on had no water glasses and was not cleaned after the previous customer.
4. Hotel's location was probably it's only good feature. It was in a busy area near market but the roads were almost always traffic jammed. It's location being so busy was good because it meant that I could go to other restaurants during lunch and dinner and would not have to eat the hotel food.
0/10 would not recommend even for one night.

I Stayed here in Dec-23. 5 star rating for Parking space, which is hard to find in almost all the hotels in Ooty.
Very old property but well maintained. Rooms are quite spacious. They have a bar as well. In house hotel with complimentary breakfast. Camp-fire is available on request. 2 mins of walkable distance from main market.
The best way to explore Ooty is to park your car in the hotel & try the local autos. (Most of the points dont have car parking)
Highly recommended if your staying Ooty.

To sum it up, I loved the hospitality of the staff , be it at the restaurant or the reception. One thing that I am sure of is next time when I come to Ooty, I would be staying at your resort for sure. It’s best recommended if you are coming with family here.

text.text: Loved our 3 night stay at Mayura Sudarshan, 2 nights in a wooden cottage and 1 night in their non ac suite in December. Wonderful property, beautiful landscape garden, which by itself is a major tourist attraction. Beautiful rooms, well maintained, clean with modern well fitted washeooms. The kitchen is well equipped, serving piping hot and fresh South Indian tasty breakfast. Very helpful and cooperative staff members of the hotel, from main desk to kitchen staff. A little further from the Ooty town centre, away from the chaos of main city but excellent location, not too far from Ooty Boat house and Rose Garden. Overall excellent stay and would love to visit again.

text.text:
Superb location. Rooms are good. Entire property itself is a park to spend time. Everyone can enjoy. Would suggest to spend sometime to in the entire garden/campus area. It's so beautiful and huge. Can be compared with any other park in Ooty.
Service is bit slow still good. Restaurant is there but so many items from menu are not available. Still whatever item is there it was fresh and good.

text.text: It was a pleasant stay. Pretty good interior, lights and ambience satisfying our visit. Best quality of food, specially being a vegetarian, best food I had in Ooty so far. Building structure is little old, furniture also little old wooden style, but looks so traditional. Outside view from the hotel is adorable specially when you come in season. There is a lot of parking space, bigger common area, a large hall and spacious rooms. We got a welcome drink when arrived, staff was very polite and always on service, whenever we needed throughout the day. A remarkable 3 star hotel in budget.

text.text: I have travelled to quite few places and I can say Byke Sunshine Ooty was a Great accommodation I have stayed till date. The rooms are clean and tidy, each and every staff were friendly, polite and very accommodating. The food was exceptional. We enjoyed our stay there. Got to know that they have branches in few more places and if we ever go on a vacation to those places we will definitely choose them. Our only suggestion for them would be to install heaters in all the rooms as Ooty is a hill station and it gets very cold during winter.

text.text: The Byke Sunshine Grand is a nice hotel with a great view to the city. The location is well accessible from the city center. The rooms are comfortable and warm. The service is very good. The staff are friendly and helpful. The food is good in the restaurant.  This is a veg only restaurant. Overall nice experience to bring family.

text.text: We had very pleasant stay @The Byke Sunshine grand,Ooty...We had stayed for 3 nights. Rooms are very spacious and clean. Location is a big plus. The staffs are very helpful ,rooms services very quick to attend to our needs. Breakfast was also tasty. We had to leave very early around 5am for our Mudumalai safari since we were traveling with kids the had even packed quick bites for us to carry akong for kids. Overall a very good peaceful stay.
